intro: Jacksonia arnhemica, commonly known as the Arnhem lily, is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Jacksonia arnhemica is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays an important role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
